{{Day}}

==Events==
* [[380]] &ndash; [[Edict of Thessalonica]]: Emperor [[Theodosius I]], with co-emperors [[Gratian]] and [[Valentinian II]], declare their wish that all [[Roman citizenship|Roman citizens]] convert to trinitarian [[Christianity]].
* [[425]] &ndash; The [[University of Constantinople]] is founded by Emperor [[Theodosius II]] at the urging of his wife [[Aelia Eudocia]].
* [[907]] &ndash; Abaoji, a [[Khitan people|Khitan]] chieftain, is enthroned as [[Emperor Taizu of Liao|Emperor Taizu]], establishing the [[Liao Dynasty]] in northern China.
*[[1560]] &ndash; The [[Treaty of Berwick (1560)|Treaty of Berwick]], which would expel the [[France|French]] from [[Scotland]], is signed by [[England]] and the [[Lords of the Congregation]] of [[Scotland]].
*[[1594]] &ndash; [[Henry IV of France|Henry IV]] is crowned [[Monarch|King]] of [[France]].
*[[1617]] &ndash; [[Sweden]] and [[Russia]] sign the [[Treaty of Stolbovo]], ending the [[Ingrian War]] and shutting [[Russia]] out of the [[Baltic Sea]].
*[[1626]] &ndash; [[Yuan Chonghuan]] is appointed Governor of [[Liaodong]], after he led the Chinese into a great victory against the [[Manchuria]]ns under [[Nurhaci]].
*[[1700]] &ndash; The island of [[New Britain]] is discovered.
*[[1776]] &ndash; [[American Revolutionary War]]: The [[Battle of Moore's Creek Bridge]] in [[North Carolina]] breaks up a [[Loyalist (American Revolution)|Loyalist]] militia.
*[[1782]] &ndash; American Revolutionary War: The [[House of Commons of Great Britain]] votes against further war in America.
*[[1801]] &ndash; Pursuant to the [[District of Columbia Organic Act of 1801]], [[Washington, D.C.]] is placed under the jurisdiction of the [[Congress of the United States|U.S. Congress]].
*[[1812]] &ndash; [[Argentine War of Independence]]: [[Manuel Belgrano]] raises the [[Flag of Argentina]] in the city of [[Rosario]] for the first time.
*  1812   &ndash; Poet [[George Gordon Byron, 6th Baron Byron|Lord Byron]] gives his first address as a member of the [[House of Lords]], in defense of [[Luddite]] violence against [[Industrialism]] in his home county of [[Nottinghamshire]].
*[[1829]] &ndash; [[Battle of Tarqui]] is fought.
*[[1844]] &ndash; The [[Dominican Republic]] gains independence from [[Haiti]].
*[[1860]] &ndash; [[Abraham Lincoln]] makes a [[Cooper_Union_Address|speech]] at [[Cooper Union]] in the city of [[New York City|New York]] that is largely responsible for his election to the [[President of the United States|Presidency]].
*[[1861]] &ndash; [[Russian Empire|Russian]] troops fire on a crowd in [[Warsaw]] protesting against [[Russia]]n rule over [[Poland]], killing five protesters.
*[[1864]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]]: The first [[Union (American Civil War)|Northern]] prisoners arrive at the [[Confederate States of America|Confederate]] prison at [[Andersonville, Georgia]].
*[[1870]] &ndash; The current [[flag of Japan]] is first adopted as the national flag for Japanese merchant ships.
*[[1881]] &ndash; [[First Boer War]]: The [[Battle of Majuba Hill]] takes place.
*[[1898]] &ndash; King [[George I of Greece]] survives an assassination attempt.
*[[1900]] &ndash; [[Second Boer War]]: In [[South Africa]], [[United Kingdom|British]] military leaders receive an unconditional notice of surrender from [[Boer]] [[General]] [[Piet Cronje]] at the [[Battle of Paardeberg]].
*  1900   &ndash; The [[Labour Party (UK)|British Labour Party]] is founded.
*  1900   &ndash; [[FC Bayern Munich|Fußball-Club Bayern München]] is founded.
*[[1902]] &ndash; [[Second Boer War]]: Australian soldier [[Harry 'Breaker' Harbord Morant]] is executed in [[Pretoria]].
*[[1921]] &ndash; The [[International Working Union of Socialist Parties]] is founded in [[Vienna]].
*[[1922]] &ndash; A challenge to the [[Nineteenth Amendment to the United States Constitution]], allowing women the right to [[vote]], is rebuffed by the [[Supreme Court of the United States]] in ''[[Leser v. Garnett]]''.
*[[1933]] &ndash; [[Reichstag fire]]: [[Weimar Republic|Germany]]'s parliament building in [[Berlin]], the [[Reichstag (building)|Reichstag]], is set on fire, apparently by the Communists.
*[[1939]] &ndash; [[United States labor law]]: The [[Supreme Court of the United States|U.S. Supreme Court]] rules that [[Sitdown strike|sit-down strikes]] violate property owners' rights and are therefore illegal.
*[[1940]] &ndash; [[Martin Kamen]] and [[Sam Ruben]] discover [[carbon-14]].
*[[1942]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: During the [[Battle of the Java Sea]], an [[ABDA|allied]] strike force is defeated by a Japanese task force in the [[Java Sea]] in the [[Dutch East Indies]].
*[[1943]] &ndash; The [[Smith Mine disaster|Smith Mine #3]] in [[Bearcreek, Montana|Bearcreek]], [[Montana]], explodes, killing 74 men.
*  1943   &ndash; The [[Rosenstrasse protest]] starts in Berlin.
*[[1951]] &ndash; The [[Twenty-second Amendment to the United States Constitution]], limiting [[President of the United States|Presidents]] to two terms, is ratified.
*[[1955]] &ndash; [[Soviet Union regional elections, 1955]].
*[[1961]] &ndash; The first congress of the [[Spanish Trade Union Organisation]] is inaugurated.
*[[1962]] &ndash; Two dissident [[Vietnam Air Force]] pilots [[1962 South Vietnamese Independence Palace bombing|bomb the Independence Palace]] in [[Saigon]] in a failed attempt to assassinate South Vietnam President [[Ngo Dinh Diem]].
*[[1963]] &ndash; The [[Dominican Republic]] receives its first democratically elected [[president]], [[Juan Bosch]], since the end of the dictatorship led by [[Rafael Trujillo]].
*[[1964]] &ndash; The Government of [[Italy]] asks for help to keep the [[Leaning Tower of Pisa]] from toppling over.
*[[1971]] &ndash; Doctors in the first [[Netherlands|Dutch]] [[abortion clinic]] (the Mildredhuis in [[Arnhem]]) start to perform ''[[abortus provocatus|aborti provocati]]''.
*[[1973]] &ndash; The [[American Indian Movement]] (AIM) [[Wounded Knee incident|occupies]] [[Wounded Knee, South Dakota]].
*[[1976]] &ndash; The formerly [[Spain|Spanish]] territory of [[Western Sahara]], under the auspices of the [[Polisario Front]] declares independence as the [[Sahrawi Arab Democratic Republic]].
*[[1986]] &ndash; The [[United States Senate]] allows its debates to be [[television|televised]] on a trial basis.
*[[1988]] &ndash; [[Sumgait pogrom]]: The [[Armenians|Armenian]] community of [[Sumgait]] in Azerbaijan is targeted in a violent massacre.
*[[1989]] &ndash; [[Venezuela]] is rocked by the [[Caracazo]] riots.
*[[1991]] &ndash; [[Gulf War]]: [[President of the United States|U.S. President]] [[George H. W. Bush]] announces that "[[Kuwait]] is liberated".
*[[1995]] &ndash; [[Zakho]]: A terrorist explosion in a market in the city of Zakho leaves about 100 dead and 150 wounded.
*[[2002]] &ndash; [[Ryanair Flight 296]] catches fire at [[London Stansted Airport]]. Subsequent investigations criticize [[Ryanair]]'s handling of the evacuation.
*  2002   &ndash; [[Godhra train burning]]: A [[Muslim]] mob kills 59 [[Hindu]] pilgrims returning from [[Ayodhya]].
*[[2004]] &ndash; A bombing of a [[Superferry 14|Superferry]] by [[Abu Sayyaf]] in the [[Philippines]]' worst terrorist attack kills 116.
*  2004   &ndash; The initial version of the [[John Jay Report]], with details about the [[Catholic sexual abuse scandal in the United States]], is released.
*[[2007]] &ndash; [[The Chinese Correction]]: The [[Shanghai Stock Exchange]] falls 9%, the largest drop in ten years.
*[[2010]] &ndash; An [[2010 Chile earthquake|earthquake]] measuring 8.8 on the [[Richter scale]] strikes central parts of [[Chile]] leaving over 500 victims, and thousands injured. The quake triggered a tsunami which struck Hawaii shortly after.
*[[2012]] &ndash; A section of a nine-story apartment building in the city of [[Astrakhan]], [[Russia]], collapses in a [[2012 Astrakhan gas explosion|natural gas explosion]], killing 10 people and injuring at least 12 others.
*[[2013]] &ndash; At least 19 people are killed when a [[2013 Kolkata market fire|fire breaks out]] at an illegal market in [[Calcutta]], [[India]].
*  2013   &ndash; 5 people (including the perpetrator) are killed and 5 others injured in a [[2013 Menznau shooting|shooting]] at a factory in [[Menznau]], [[Switzerland]].
